item.title: 2023 AMC 8 Problem 20
item.description:
Two integers are inserted into the list $3, 3, 8, 11, 28$ to double its range. The mode and median remain unchanged. What is the maximum possible sum of the two additional numbers?

Options:

  • (A) 56
  • (B) 57
  • (C) 58
  • (D) 60
  • (E) 61

Solution

To double the range, we must first find the current range, which is $28 - 3 = 25$. To double it, we need a range of $2(25) = 50$. To keep the median unchanged, we must choose a number smaller than 8 (to avoid changing the mode) and a number larger than 28. The optimal choice for the smaller number is 7 (as any number smaller than 3 will not help in maximizing the range). For the larger number, we select 53, as it maximizes the range without affecting the mode.
